hero.title: Systems Engineering Student & Data Scientist
hero.description: Advanced Systems Engineering student, passionate about Artificial Intelligence and data science. Member of the GISAI research group and the DataStatLab laboratory, where I apply my knowledge in development and data visualization.

about.title: About Me
about.subtitle: Engineering student passionate about artificial intelligence, data analysis, and the development of innovative data-driven solutions.
about.history1: I am a UTN student with a strong interest in artificial intelligence and data analysis. I have experience in data analysis and development of predictive models, combining statistical tools and programming to extract valuable information from large volumes of data.
about.history2: During my academic and professional career, I have worked with Python and its main data analysis and machine learning libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn), as well as SQL databases and visualization in Power BI. Additionally, I have experience in time series analysis models such as SARIMA and Holt-Winters, as well as in Deep Learning, applying LSTM neural networks for sequential data prediction.
about.history3: I am motivated by research and development of new artificial intelligence technologies, always seeking to optimize processes and discover innovative solutions.

projects.title: My Projects

p1.title: Research and Development in Time Series
p1.description: As a member of GISAI, I developed prediction models (SARIMA and LSTM) to analyze the behavior of photovoltaic production at UTN, applying AI and Deep Learning.
p1.details:
As a member of the GISAI research group (Research Group in Signals, Systems, and Artificial Intelligence), I actively participated in the statistical analysis of the time series and the creation and development of prediction models for photovoltaic production at the National Technological University (UTN), C贸rdoba Regional Faculty.

Developed models:
- SARIMA (Seasonal AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average): Statistical model to capture seasonality and trends in historical solar production data.
- LSTM (Long Short-Term Memory): Recurrent neural network specialized in time series, used to compare its performance against the traditional statistical model.

Both models were evaluated using metrics such as MAE and RMSE, which allowed analyzing their advantages and limitations in the context of energy prediction. This experience allowed me to deepen my knowledge in data analysis, time series processing, and the application of advanced Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques to solve real challenges in the field of renewable energy.

p2.title: Data Analysis and Visualization
p2.description: Development and management of databases, and creation of interactive dashboards.
p2.details: In my role at DataStatLab, I am responsible for the entire data lifecycle. From initial collection and cleaning, through storage and management in SQL and NoSQL databases, to processing and transformation for analysis. Finally, I create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI and Tableau to facilitate data-driven decision making.

p3.title: Speaker at Smart Grids & AI Seminar
p3.description: Presentation on the application of AI in smart electrical grids.
p3.details: With GISAI, we had the honor of being invited as speakers at the internal seminar on Smart Grids and Artificial Intelligence at UTN - C贸rdoba Regional Faculty. Our presentation focused on how AI algorithms can be used to make predictions of electric energy production. Together with the group, we presented our prediction models (SARIMA, Holt-Winters, and LSTM) to make 1-year predictions of photovoltaic production for a group of solar panels, sharing knowledge and case studies with professionals in the sector.
